BiblioData.Title: ELEVATED LED AND METHOD OF PRODUCING SUCH
BiblioData.Abstract: The present invention relates to light emitting diodes comprising at least one nanowire. The LED according to the invention is an upstanding nanostructure with the nanowire protruding from a substrate. A bulb with a larger diameter than the nanowire is arranged in connection to the nanowire and at an elevated position with regards to the substrate. A pn-junction is formed by the combination of the bulb and the nanowire resulting in an active region to produce light.

Claims.P: 1. Upstanding nanostructured LED (100) comprising a substrate (105) and a nanowire (110) protruding from the substrate, characterized by a bulb (115) arranged in connection to the nanowire (110) and at an elevated position with regards to the substrate, the bulb having a larger diameter than the nanowire (110), and the bulb comprising an active region (120) to produce light.

2. LED according to claim 1, wherein the bulb (115) is epitaxially connected to the nanowire (110) and arranged to provide a high doping degree for the formation of a pn-junction associated with the active region (120).
3. LED according to claim 1 or 2, wherein the distance between the active region (120) and the surface of the bulb is in the same order of magnitude in essentially all directions.
4. LED according to claim 3, wherein the bulb (115) is cylindrical.
5. LED according to claim 3, wherein the bulb (115) is spherical.
6. LED according to claim 3 to 5 , wherein the diameter of the bulb (115) is in the order of 500nm.

7. LED according to claim 1, wherein the bulb (115) comprises of at least two layers (116, 117) in a shell-like structure (110) on the nanowire (110) and the active region is provided in one of the layers (116, 117) and extends radially outwards from the nanowire (110).
8. LED according to any of claims 1 to 7, wherein the elevation of the bulb with respect to the substrate is more than 30 nm.
9. LED according to any of claims 1 to 7, wherein the substrate is provided with a reflecting layer (108).
10. The nanostructured LED according to claim. 9, wherein the reflecting layer is a multilayered structure.

12. The nanostructured LED according to claim 9, wherein reflecting means are provided by an reflective layer (108) extending under a part of the nanowire and covering an outer portion of the cross section of the nanowire (110).
13. The nanostructured LED according to any of claims 2 to 12, wherein the reflecting means are provided in the nanowire and the reflecting means is a multilayered structure.
